place.name: SOUTH ELMHAM ST CROSS
place.gazetteerText: ELMHAM (South)-St. Cross, or Sandcroft, a parish in Wangford district, Suffolk; adjacent to the river Waveney, and to the Waveney Valley railway, near Homersfield r. station, 5 miles SW of Bungay. Post town, South Elmham-St. Margaret, under Harlestone. Acres, 1, 110. Real property, £1, 973. Pop., 238. Houses, 46. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory, annexed to the rectory of Homersfield, in the diocese of Norwich. The church is tolerable. Some remains exist of a moated minster, with nave 42 feet by 27, and apsidal chancel 24 feet. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

unit.name: SOUTH ELMHAM ST CROSS WITH HOMERSFIELD
